small town in East Texas I was lucky to
have fantastic parents who really
supported what I did growing up my dad
was a police officer he was a
commissioned officer in the state of
Texas so he went out and he did a lot of

which was great I started hanging out
with my dad a little more went on some

this police work could be interesting
but I didn't want to be a police officer
I didn't want to have a gun and a badge
and write tickets and that sort of thing
and I loved science as I started going
through school so chemistry is in

we're already in a hundred degree

there are three major categories that we
look at in regards to fingerprints loops
whirls and arches so loops are the most
common you have ridges that come in from
one side and then turn and go right back
out the other if you have a whirl it
kind of spins around in a circle and
then arches have ridges that come in and
they go right back down arches are the
rarest about five percent of the
population has that very good alright
now we can get the fun part you get to

so the fun part about forensic science

they're not visible to the naked eye so
sometimes we have to use chemical

there's a lot more so with fingerprints
we could put our fingerprint on the

transitioned into recovering DNA from
fire scenes so for example we have this
plate and a piece of paper in it which
is going to represent our scene usually
when we think of a fire scene that's imp
to like this oh we have a fire and we
assume that everything is going to be
consumed that there's no evidence left
behind for us to see however in reality
our house is completely empty
no what do you have in your house you
have furniture you have a bed you have a
kitchen refrigerator table etc so these
things can actually cover and protect
some of the areas that may contain DNA
evidence so we'll use this pan to
demonstrate what that looks like so we
have our paper on bottom again but this
time we have some fabric a brick in a
stone that is sort of covering there we
go our fabric
so as the fire burns now if you go in
you would think Oh everything is gone
everything has been consumed in the fire
however if I lift this brick up look
what's left behind and if I lift the
paper up what's left underneath bits and
pieces of our scene and that's what we
want to look at sometimes it's what's
protected in a scene that we really need
to go back and really evaluate in order
to get our DNA profiles with this I
would be able to go back lift up the
items and see what was underneath and
possibly use that to help gather clues
to help solve the crime that we're
investigating so I absolutely love my
job my job is fantastic it's the coolest
job on the planet I get to light things
on fire I get to see what's left I get
to recover DNA profiles and ultimately
we hope that this makes for a safer
community I encourage you all as you go
through school love love love your
science classes embrace them sometimes
they can be really hard right they give
you really hard classes but ultimately
in life it can help save your community
so thank you very much for your time
today
